Exclusive | 'Don't underestimate Shubman Gill' - Harbhajan Singh
With the Asia Cup 2025 squad set to be announced, Harbhajan Singh has backed Shubman Gill for inclusion despite stiff competition from India’s power-hitters. Bhajji insisted Gill’s solid basics and adaptability make him a potential T20 dominator. Calling this a “new era” without Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, Harbhajan praised the youngsters for carrying forward Indian cricket’s legacy.
EXCLUSIVE | Harbhajan Singh: 'Don't underestimate Shubman Gill, he can dominate T20Is too' | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIAsia CupSchedulePoints TableT20 RankingsIND Vs PAK: Face-OffIND Vs BAN: Face-OffToday's ePaperNewsSports NewsCricket NewsEXCLUSIVE | Harbhajan Singh: 'Don't underestimate Shubman Gill, he can dominate T20Is too'TrendingSuryakumar YadavSaaniya ChandhokMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliJaved MiandadKedar JadhavR AshwinSuryakumar YadavSaaniya ChandhokMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliJaved MiandadKedar JadhavR AshwinSuryakumar YadavSaaniya ChandhokMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliJaved MiandadKedar JadhavR AshwinEXCLUSIVE | Harbhajan Singh: 'Don't underestimate Shubman Gill, he can dominate T20Is too'Amit Kumar / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Aug 18, 2025, 15:41 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeWith the Asia Cup 2025 squad set to be announced, Harbhajan Singh has backed Shubman Gill for inclusion despite stiff competition from India’s power-hitters. Bhajji insisted Gill’s solid basics and adaptability make him a potential T20 dominator. Calling this a “new era” without Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, Harbhajan praised the youngsters for carrying forward Indian cricket’s legacy. India's player of the series India's captain Shubman Gill on day five of the fifth cricket test match between England and India at The Kia Oval in London, Monday, Aug. 4, 2025. (AP Photo/Kirsty Wigglesworth) NEW DELHI: The Asia Cup 2025 India squad is set to be announced, and the burning question is whether Test captain Shubman Gill will find a place in the team. With India’s T20I batting lineup already packed with hard-hitters like Abhishek Sharma, Yashasvi Jaiswal, Sanju Samson, Tilak Varma, captain Suryakumar Yadav, and Hardik Pandya, the selectors face a “sweet headache” when it comes to Gill’s inclusion.India’s top six T20I batters boast impressive strike rates: Abhishek Sharma (193.84), Suryakumar Yadav (167.07), Yashasvi Jaiswal (164.31), Hardik Pandya (141.67), Tilak Varma (155.07), and Sanju Samson (152.38).Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!In comparison, Gill has played 21 T20Is so far, with a strike rate of 139.27.So, will the selectors still back Shubman?Former India spinner Harbhajan Singh, who has closely observed Gill, strongly believes the youngster deserves a place in the squad.“In the T20 format, it’s important to understand that it’s not just about big hitting. If Shubman decides to attack, he can match anyone, because he is a very solid player with strong basics. A batter with such a strong foundation can score runs in any format," Harbhajan told TimesofIndia.com in an exclusive interview."If you look at the IPL, Shubman has scored runs every season. He has worn the Orange Cap — and that doesn’t happen by chance. And it’s not like he bats only at a strike rate of 120 or 130; he can also bat at a strike rate of 160," he added."Yes, we do have players like Abhishek Sharma, Suryakumar Yadav, and Tilak Varma, but you cannot undermine or underestimate Shubman Gill. He is a very talented batter who can adapt to any format. He is an all-format player. In my opinion, he can play T20s and even dominate the format. We as fans are used to seeing fours and sixes every ball, but you also need batters who can play long innings and rescue the team when required,” Harbhajan said.When asked to name his 15 for the Asia Cup, which is set to be picked on Tuesday, Harbhajan replied: "I think the squad should be: Yashasvi Jaiswal, Abhishek Sharma, Shubman Gill, Suryakumar Yadav – the captain, Hardik Pandya, Shreyas Iyer, Washington Sundar, Riyan Parag for the middle order, Kuldeep Yadav, Axar Patel, Mohammed Siraj, Arshdeep Singh, KL Rahul, Jasprit Bumrah and Rishabh Pant.”'CRICKET NEVER STOPS FOR ANYONE'The Asia Cup will mark India’s first major multi-team tournament without stalwarts Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma. The duo featured in India’s previous two global triumphs — the ICC T20 World Cup 2024 and the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 — both won under Rohit’s leadership.This, as Harbhajan puts it, is the beginning of a new era.“See, cricket never stops for anyone. Whether we talk about the time of Sunil Gavaskar, Kapil Dev, or Sachin Tendulkar, the game has always gone on. Someone or the other comes in and takes the team forward. Right now, the way Shubman Gill and his team-mates have played in England… Rohit and Virat have left their legacy in the right hands. We have seen the shift happen smoothly. It will be a big tournament that will be played without Virat and Rohit," Harbhajan said.PollShould Shubman Gill be included in the Asia Cup 2025 squad?Yes, he deserves a spotNo, we have better options"The way these youngsters have taken responsibility… I believe this is the natural rule of life — change is inevitable. If there is no change, things become stagnant. Moving forward is always good. And the way Shubman Gill and his team-mates have performed, it’s really pleasing to see."Of course, we have seen this shift earlier as well. When the big players move on, someone else steps up, takes responsibility, and carries the team forward. As long as the team keeps moving in the right direction, that is the main goal. The way Gill and his team have played in England, Rohit and Virat have definitely left their legacy in safe hands,” he added.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. Arjun Tendulkar engaged to Saaniya Chandok: How has Sachin's son performed on the field?
Arjun Tendulkar, son of cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar, recently got engaged to Saaniya Chandok, who hails from a prominent Mumbai business family. The private, family-oriented ceremony marks a joyous occasion for both families.
Arjun Tendulkar engaged to Saaniya Chandok: How has Sachin's son performed on the field? | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIsportsCricketNFLNBANHLCollege FootballMLCAsia Cup 2025Live Cricket ScoreMLBEsportsInternational SportsFormula EWWEF1MMATennisBadmintonHockeyWeb StoriesVideosRacingAthleticsWrestlingShootingBoxingChessIPL 2025Today's ePaperIPL 2025WPLCricket ScheduleLive Cricket ScoreICC RankingsNewsSports NewsCricket NewsArjun Tendulkar engaged to Saaniya Chandok: How has Sachin's son performed on the field?TrendingSuryakumar YadavSaaniya ChandhokMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliCincinnati Open Final Live StreamingKedar JadhavR AshwinSuryakumar YadavSaaniya ChandhokMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliCincinnati Open Final Live StreamingKedar JadhavR AshwinSuryakumar YadavSaaniya ChandhokMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliCincinnati Open Final Live StreamingKedar JadhavR AshwinArjun Tendulkar engaged to Saaniya Chandok: How has Sachin's son performed on the field?TOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM /  Aug 18, 2025, 16:17 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeArjun Tendulkar, son of cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar, recently got engaged to Saaniya Chandok, who hails from a prominent Mumbai business family. The private, family-oriented ceremony marks a joyous occasion for both families. Arjun Tenkulkar and Saaniya Chandok. Arjun Tendulkar has become the talk of social media after news of his engagement to Saaniya Chandok went viral. The young cricketer, son of Indian legend Sachin Tendulkar, is part of the Mumbai Indians set-up in the IPL and made his debut for the franchise in 2023. Saaniya comes from a well-known business family in Mumbai. She is the granddaughter of entrepreneur Ravi Ghai, whose family has built a strong legacy in the hospitality and food industries, owning the InterContinental hotel and Brooklyn Creamery. The engagement was kept private, away from the glare of cameras and lavish parties. It was a simple, family-focused occasion that underlined the close bond between the two families, making it all the more special.Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW! At 25, Arjun is still shaping his cricket career. With Mumbai Indians, he has featured in five IPL matches so far. His only batting opportunity saw him strike a six and score 13 off nine balls, while with the ball he has claimed three wickets. Away from the IPL, he represents Goa in domestic cricket and continues to grow as an all-rounder.PollDo you think Arjun Tendulkar's engagement will inspire him in his cricket career?Yes, absolutely!Maybe, it's possible.Not sure.His record includes 17 first-class games with 532 runs and 37 wickets, 18 List A matches with 102 runs and 25 wickets, and 24 T20 appearances where he has 119 runs and 27 wickets to his name. Known for swinging the new ball and chipping in with the bat down the order, Arjun is still considered a player with plenty of promise. For the Tendulkar family, this is a moment of joy and celebration. While fans are eager to see Arjun back on the field after missing out on game time during IPL 2025, he now looks ahead to upcoming domestic cricket and league opportunities, while also stepping into a new chapter in his personal life with Saaniya.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. Left out of Eng series, Sarfaraz sends strong message to India selectors with ...
Sarfaraz Khan, aiming for a national team recall, showcased his batting prowess by scoring a rapid 138 for Mumbai in the Buchi Babu Invitational Tournament. His innings, featuring 10 fours and six sixes, included significant partnerships, further solidifying his claim for selection in India's upcoming home series against the West Indies and South Africa.
Left out of England series, Sarfaraz Khan sends strong message to India selectors with Buchi Babu knock | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOITOI GamesLive VideosCityMetro CitiesmumbaidelhibengaluruHyderabadkolkatachennaiOther CitiesCityagraagartalaahmedabadajmeramaravatiamritsarbareillybhubaneswarbhopalchandigarhchhatrapati sambhajinagarcoimbatorecuttackdehradunerodefaridabadghaziabadgoagurgaonguwahatihubballiimphalindoreitanagarjaipurjammujamshedpurjodhpurkanpurkochikohimakolhapurkozhikodeludhianalucknowmaduraimangalurumeerutmumbai regionmysurunagpurnashiknavi mumbainoidapatnaprayagrajpuducherrypuneraipurrajkotranchithanesalemshillongshimlasrinagarsurattrichythiruvananthapuramudaipurvadodaravaranasivijayawadavisakhapatnamphotosWeb StoriesIndiafeaturedOperation SindoorCancel PatriarchyMaharashtraDelhiKarnatakaTamil NaduTelanganaUttar PradeshWest BengalGujaratMadhya PradeshBiharChandigarhRajasthanArunachal PradeshAndhra PradeshAssamChhattisgarhGoaHaryanaHimachal PradeshJammu KashmirJharkhandKeralaManipurMeghalayaMizoramNagalandOdishaPunjabSikkimTripuraUttarakhandAndaman Nicobar IslandsDadra Nagar HaveliDaman DiuLakshadweepPondicherryWeb StoriesSaving Our StripesDigital ArrestWorldBusinessTechCricketSportsEntertainmentAstroTVEducationLife & StyleWeb SeriesTimes EvokePhotosBlogsToday's ePaperNewsLeft out of England series, Sarfaraz Khan sends strong message to India selectors with Buchi Babu knockLeft out of England series, Sarfaraz Khan sends strong message to India selectors with Buchi Babu knockTOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM /  Aug 18, 2025, 18:03 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeSarfaraz Khan, aiming for a national team recall, showcased his batting prowess by scoring a rapid 138 for Mumbai in the Buchi Babu Invitational Tournament. His innings, featuring 10 fours and six sixes, included significant partnerships, further solidifying his claim for selection in India's upcoming home series against the West Indies and South Africa. Sarfaraz Khan (Photo by Steve Bardens/Getty Images) Sarfaraz Khan, a 27-year-old middle-order batter with 371 runs in six Test matches for India, displayed his skills by scoring a century for Mumbai in the Buchi Babu Invitational Tournament on Monday.Playing under captain Ayush Mhatre against TNCA XI at Gojan Cricket Ground B, Sarfaraz batted at number 5 position and scored an impressive 138 runs from 114 balls before retiring hurt.His innings was highlighted by 10 fours and six sixes. Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!He formed crucial partnerships, including a 72-run stand for the fourth wicket with Suved Parkar, who contributed 72 runs from 121 balls, and another substantial partnership exceeding 100 runs for the sixth wicket with Aakash Parkar.Sarfaraz's Test career began impressively with two fifties on his debut against England in Rajkot last year. He followed this with a remarkable 150 in the second innings of the Bengaluru Test against New Zealand in November 2024.Despite his strong performance record, Sarfaraz was not selected for India's five-match Test series in England. The selectors opted for Karun Nair instead in the series opener against England.Sarfaraz has maintained an impressive batting average of 65.98 in first-class cricket. He has recently focused on improving his fitness, and his century in this tournament strengthens his case for selection in India's upcoming home series.India are scheduled to play against the West Indies from October 2 to 14, with matches in Ahmedabad and Delhi. This will be followed by two Tests against South Africa in Kolkata from November 14-18 and in Guwahati from November 22-26.Following his participation in the Buchi Babu Invitational Tournament, Sarfaraz will join the West Zone team for the Duleep Trophy. The 2025 Duleep Trophy is scheduled from August 28 to September 11.Sarfaraz will play under Shardul Thakur's leadership in the Duleep Trophy. The West Zone squad also includes notable players Ruturaj Gaikwad and Shreyas Iyer.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. Bumrah offered fresh advice on workload: 'Our physios are the better judges'
Former BCCI chairman Chetan Sharma has defended Jasprit Bumrah's decision to play only three Tests against England, citing workload management based on medical advice. Sharma expressed confidence in India's chances at the upcoming Asia Cup, emphasising the team's strong performance and the advantage of hosting the T20 World Cup in 2026.
Jasprit Bumrah offered fresh advice on workload management: 'Our physios are the better judges' | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIsportsCricketNFLNBANHLCollege FootballMLCAsia Cup 2025Live Cricket ScoreMLBEsportsInternational SportsFormula EWWEF1MMATennisBadmintonHockeyWeb StoriesVideosRacingAthleticsWrestlingShootingBoxingChessIPL 2025Today's ePaperIPL 2025WPLCricket ScheduleLive Cricket ScoreICC RankingsNewsSports NewsCricket NewsJasprit Bumrah offered fresh advice on workload management: 'Our physios are the better judges'TrendingSuryakumar YadavSaaniya ChandhokMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliCincinnati Open Final Live StreamingKedar JadhavR AshwinSuryakumar YadavSaaniya ChandhokMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliCincinnati Open Final Live StreamingKedar JadhavR AshwinSuryakumar YadavSaaniya ChandhokMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliCincinnati Open Final Live StreamingKedar JadhavR AshwinJasprit Bumrah offered fresh advice on workload management: 'Our physios are the better judges'TOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM /  Aug 18, 2025, 17:08 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeFormer BCCI chairman Chetan Sharma has defended Jasprit Bumrah's decision to play only three Tests against England, citing workload management based on medical advice. Sharma expressed confidence in India's chances at the upcoming Asia Cup, emphasising the team's strong performance and the advantage of hosting the T20 World Cup in 2026.  Jasprit Bumrah (Photo by Gareth Copley/Getty Images) Former BCCI chairman of selectors Chetan Sharma has supported Jasprit Bumrah's decision to play only three Tests in the five-match Anderson-Tendulkar series against England. The decision was made to manage Bumrah's workload, despite facing criticism.Bumrah, who has been prone to injuries, participated in the first, third, and fourth Tests while Mohammed Siraj led the pace attack in the remaining matches.Sharma, a former pace bowler himself, compared the situation to following a doctor's advice.Jasprit Bumrah press conference: Hits out at critics, on Lord's Honours Boards, ball controversyGo Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!"If the medical team advises, if the doctor tells me that I have to take antibiotics, then I have to consume them," Sharma said in "The Great Indian Cricket Show" on Doordarshan. "If our physios are telling a player to manage workload, I think we should listen to them because they are the better judges."The comments were made at an event where Prasar Bharati, the country's public service broadcaster, signed a deal with London-based cricket analytics company.Sharma, who had a successful bowling partnership with Kapil Dev and claimed over 125 wickets in Tests and ODIs, expressed confidence in India's chances at the upcoming Asia Cup in the UAE."I know that whoever is selected will be the best for the country. And the kind of cricket we are playing right now, I'm really proud with the way India played in England," he added."And I'm very confident that we are definitely going to win the Asia Cup (to be played in T20 format) because soon after that we are playing the T20 World Cup (in 2026) in India."It's a very big thing when you are playing (the World Cup) in you own backyard. If the intent is right, the results will also be good."The event was attended by notable cricket personalities including Madan Lal from the 1983 World Cup-winning team, former India players Murali Kartik and Aakash Chopra, along with Prasar Bharati Chairman Navneet Kumar Sehgal.When asked about including Test captain Shubman Gill, who scored four centuries in the drawn England series, in the Asia Cup squad under Suryakumar Yadav's leadership, Sharma emphasised the need for selecting the best possible team. "Look, that is up to the selectors what they see. My opinion does not matter because I am no longer the chairman (of selectors), so I will only say that the best possible team should be selected," he stated."We have such good cricketers that not just the top-15 but even if the top-30 are selected, they are all very good. Really proud of them."Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. From running live blogs for India and non-India cricket matches to global spectacles featuring Indian talents, like the Chess World Cup final featuring Praggnanandhaa and the Badminton World Championships semifinal featuring HS Prannoy, our live coverage extends to all mega sporting events. We extensively cover events like the Olympics, Asian Games, Cricket World Cups, FIFA World Cups, and more. 

The desk is also adept at writing comprehensive match reports and insightful post-match commentary, complemented by stats-based articles that provide an in-depth analysis of player performances and team dynamics. 

We track news wires for key stories, conduct exclusive player interviews in both text and video formats, and file content from print editions and reporters. We keep track of all viral stories, trending topics and produce our own copies on the subjects.

Asia Cup 2025: SKY to stay as India’s T20I captain, Gill likely to miss out
India are set to back Suryakumar Yadav as T20I captain for Asia Cup 2025, with Shubman Gill and Shreyas Iyer likely to miss out despite stellar form. Samson, Abhishek Sharma, and Tilak Varma remain first-choice batters, while Jasprit Bumrah returns to lead the attack. Mohammed Siraj is expected to be rested, with Prasidh Krishna and Washington Sundar among likely inclusions.
Asia Cup 2025: Suryakumar Yadav to stay as India’s T20I captain, Shubman Gill likely to miss out | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIAsia CupSchedulePoints TableT20 RankingsIND Vs PAK: Face-OffIND Vs BAN: Face-OffToday's ePaperNewsSports NewsCricket NewsAsia Cup 2025: Suryakumar Yadav to stay as India’s T20I captain, Shubman Gill likely to miss outTrendingSuryakumar YadavSaaniya ChandhokMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliJaved MiandadKedar JadhavR AshwinSuryakumar YadavSaaniya ChandhokMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliJaved MiandadKedar JadhavR AshwinSuryakumar YadavSaaniya ChandhokMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliJaved MiandadKedar JadhavR AshwinAsia Cup 2025: Suryakumar Yadav to stay as India’s T20I captain, Shubman Gill likely to miss outGaurav Gupta / TNN / Updated: Aug 18, 2025, 13:51 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeIndia are set to back Suryakumar Yadav as T20I captain for Asia Cup 2025, with Shubman Gill and Shreyas Iyer likely to miss out despite stellar form. Samson, Abhishek Sharma, and Tilak Varma remain first-choice batters, while Jasprit Bumrah returns to lead the attack. Mohammed Siraj is expected to be rested, with Prasidh Krishna and Washington Sundar among likely inclusions. Indian cricket team Mumbai: The focus is likely to be on maintaining continuity and keeping faith in the young and successful T20 specialists when the Indian selectors meet here at the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) headquarters on Tuesday to pick the squad for the Asia Cup (to be played in the T20 format) in the UAE, scheduled from September 9-28.The meeting will be attended by India's T20 captain Suryakumar Yadav, who will fly in from Bengaluru after clearing his fitness test at the BCCI's Centre of Excellence (CoE), which means SKY stays on as India’s T20 captain, possibly till the 2026 T20 World Cup in India and Sri Lanka.EXCLUSIVE: India to boycott Pakistan in Asia Cup? Harbhajan Singh says, 'Khoon aur paani ek saath nahi beh sakte'Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!Contrary to expectations, star batter and India's Test captain Shubman Gill, who was tipped in some quarters to take over the vice-captaincy role in the T20 format after a highly successful tour of England, where he scored 754 runs in five Tests @75.40 with a top score of 269, is currently struggling to even make it to what is likely to be not more than a 15-man squad -- unless head coach Gautam Gambhir pushes for his inclusion in the T20 format too."Gill is a terrific batsman, all the selectors and head coach Gautam Gambhir are huge fans of his batting, and he is rated almost as highly as Virat Kohli in India’s cricket circles in terms of potential. However, he doesn’t fit into the T20 scheme of things right now. Presently, the idea is to persist with ‘keeper-bat Sanju Samson and Abhishek Sharma as openers, with Tilak Varma coming in at No. 3 and skipper Suryakumar at No. 4. If you see, Abhishek and Varma are rated as the No. 1 & No. 2 batters in T20Is in the ICC rankings currently. How can you keep them out?" a source close to the developments told TOI.Gill had a successful IPL 2025 too, where he slammed 650 runs in 15 matches @50.00, at a strike rate of 155.87, with six fifties, while captaining the Gujarat Titans. Along with young left-hander Sai Sudharsan, the 25-year-old forged an extremely prolific opening combination for GT.India captain Shubman Gill speaks during a press conference at Edgbaston, Birmingham, England, Tuesday July 1, 2025. AP/PTI(AP07_01_2025_000278A)However, Samson, Sharma, and Varma have done enough in T20Is last year to have the team management's confidence in them, at least for now. Samson smashed three hundreds in T20Is last year -- two against South Africa in an away series (107 & 109*) and one (111) against Bangladesh at Hyderabad in the home series. Tilak cracked back-to-back centuries (107 not out & 120 not out) against South Africa in November 2024. The 22-year-old had an average IPL this time for the Mumbai Indians, managing 343 runs in 16 matches @31.18 with two fifties, but that is unlikely to be held against him."Even Hardik Pandya had a bad IPL last year (while captaining MI), but he turned out to be one of India’s biggest heroes of their 2024 T20 World Cup triumph in the West Indies. Even greats like Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma have endured bad IPLs, but they were a different beast while playing for India in T20Is. You can’t judge a player just by one IPL," a source pointed out.Abhishek, of course, is a certainty after bludgeoning a scintillating 135 off just 54 balls, including 13 sixes and seven fours, against England at the Wankhede Stadium on February 2 this year. Incidentally, it was the last T20I India played before the Asia Cup.New Delhi: Sunrisers Hyderabad's Abhishek Sharma plays a shot during an Indian Premier League (IPL) 2025 T20 cricket match between Kolkata Knight Riders and Sunrisers Hyderabad, at the Arun Jaitley Stadium, in New Delhi. (PTI Photo/Atul Yadav)  *** Local Caption ***"The current top four in India’s T20 cricket reflect their new-found resolve to play fearlessly in this format. In fact, if you are talking about taking a third opener in the Asia Cup squad, the case of Yashasvi Jaiswal is stronger than Gill's. Jaiswal has the tendency to hit a lot more boundaries in the Powerplay overs, which is mandatory in today’s T20 cricket. If you remember, Jaiswal was in India’s main squad in the T20 World Cup last year, while Gill was in the reserves," the source said.However, it’s learnt that Jaiswal, who scored two hundreds in the Test series in England (101 at Leeds & 118 at The Oval), has been asked to focus on red-ball cricket for now, considering India are scheduled to play four home Tests in the 2025-26 season—two each against West Indies and South Africa.PollWho do you think should be the vice-captain for India's T20 squad?Shubman GillSanju SamsonAbhishek SharmaShreyas IyerIyer too struggling to make the cutLike Gill, Shreyas Iyer is also struggling to make the cut, despite captaining Punjab Kings to the final of IPL 2025 and being in blazing form with the bat. The 30-year-old was India’s top run-getter in their Champions Trophy triumph in Dubai in March, scoring 243 runs in five matches @48.60, including two fifties. He scored 79 off 98 against New Zealand in the group stage, then 45 off 62 against Australia in the semifinal, and 48 off 62 in the final. However, he is competing with big-hitting left-handers, allrounder Shivam Dube and ‘finisher’ Rinku Singh.Bumrah set to be back, Siraj likely to be restedIn encouraging news for Team India, world No. 1 pacer Jasprit Bumrah, who played three Tests in England and was under the scanner for workload management, has conveyed his availability to the selectors for the Asia Cup, and will thus lead India’s attack."Bumrah had a minor knee injury, but will be fit for the Asia Cup. He is supposed to report to the BCCI’s CoE on August 30 for a fitness assessment," a source told TOI.London: India's Jasprit Bumrah and Prasidh Krishna during a training session ahead of the fifth Test cricket match between India and England, in London. (PTI Photo/R Senthilkumar)With the final of the Asia Cup set for September 28 in Dubai and the first Test against West Indies starting on October 2 in Ahmedabad, there’s a fair chance that Bumrah will miss at least the first Test of that series. Meanwhile, pacer Mohammed Siraj, who took nine for 190 in the fifth Test at The Oval and finished with 23 wickets in the England series, is likely to be rested from the Asia Cup. He will, however, be available for the home Tests.Apart from Bumrah, left-arm seamer Arshdeep Singh, Prasidh Krishna -- who won the Purple Cap in IPL 2025 with 25 wickets in 15 matches @19.52 for Gujarat Titans -- and Hardik Pandya will be the other seamers. Prasidh, though, could be competing for a spot with Delhi pacer Harshit Rana.Among spinners, Varun Chakravarthy and Kuldeep Yadav are certainties on the slow UAE wickets, while off-spinning allrounder Washington Sundar is almost guaranteed a spot.Kolkata: Kolkata Knight Riders' Varun Chakravarthy celebrates with teammates after taking the wicket of Chennai Super Kings' Dewald Brevis during an Indian Premier League (IPL) 2025 T20 cricket match between Kolkata Knight Riders and Chennai Super Kings, at the Eden Gardens, in Kolkata, West Bengal. (PTI Photo/Swapan Mahapatra)The Asia Cup will begin with Afghanistan vs Hong Kong in Abu Dhabi on September 9. Clubbed in Group A with arch-rivals Pakistan, UAE and Oman, India will launch their campaign against UAE on September 10 in Dubai. They take on Pakistan on September 14 in the league stage, and most likely again in the Super Four stage on September 21. The final is scheduled for September 28.Jitesh Sharma, a star performer for IPL 2025 champions RCB (261 runs in 15 matches @37.28, SR 176.35, including a top score of 85*), is expected to be picked as the second wicketkeeper in the squad.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. Untold tale: Sunil Gavaskar could get away with murder - Ex-teammate
Karsan Ghavri revealed Sunil Gavaskar's unwavering focus, recalling an instance when Gavaskar prioritized his batting concentration over meeting then Prime Minister Morarji Desai. Ghavri also highlighted Gavaskar's infamous slow innings in the 1975 World Cup, where he defied team expectations and played at his own pace, frustrating teammates with his unconventional approach.
Untold tale: Sunil Gavaskar 'could get away with murder', once snubbed the Prime Minister - Ex-teammate | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIsportsCricketNFLNBANHLCollege FootballMLCAsia Cup 2025Live Cricket ScoreMLBEsportsInternational SportsFormula EWWEF1MMATennisBadmintonHockeyWeb StoriesVideosRacingAthleticsWrestlingShootingBoxingChessIPL 2025Today's ePaperIPL 2025WPLCricket ScheduleLive Cricket ScoreICC RankingsNewsSports NewsCricket NewsUntold tale: Sunil Gavaskar 'could get away with murder', once snubbed the Prime Minister - Ex-teammateTrendingNeymar JRSaaniya ChandhokMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliJaved MiandadKedar JadhavR AshwinNeymar JRSaaniya ChandhokMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliJaved MiandadKedar JadhavR AshwinNeymar JRSaaniya ChandhokMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliJaved MiandadKedar JadhavR AshwinUntold tale: Sunil Gavaskar 'could get away with murder', once snubbed the Prime Minister - Ex-teammateTOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Aug 18, 2025, 12:52 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeKarsan Ghavri revealed Sunil Gavaskar's unwavering focus, recalling an instance when Gavaskar prioritized his batting concentration over meeting then Prime Minister Morarji Desai. Ghavri also highlighted Gavaskar's infamous slow innings in the 1975 World Cup, where he defied team expectations and played at his own pace, frustrating teammates with his unconventional approach. LONDON, ENGLAND - AUGUST 03: Media member and former Indian cpatain, Sunil Gavaskar speaks during day four of the Fifth Test Match between England and India at The Kia Oval on August 03, 2025 in London, England. (Photo by Stu Forster/Getty Images) Former India cricketer Karsan Ghavri shared a few interesting facts about his ex-teammate Sunil Gavaskar and explained why the legendary India batter's aura will remain unmatched in Indian cricket.Ghavri said once the Indian team was playing a Test match against Australia at the then Feroz Shah Kotla Stadium in Delhi. On the day of the game, former Prime Minister Morarji Desai was scheduled to meet players from both sides. However, Mr. Desai arrived 10 minutes late, and by then the toss had already taken place, with India set to bat first.Virat Kohli, Ravi Shastri & India’s Pace Revolution | Bharat Arun Reveals Untold Team India StoriesGo Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!"Sunil Gavaskar was all set. Padded up. He was sitting in the dressing room and concentrating," Ghavri told Vickey Lalwani on his YouTube channel."Raj Singh Dungarpur was there, and in the meantime, he was concentrating. Sunil was about to go out and bat in a few minutes. Raj Singh said, 'Come on, everyone. The Prime Minister is here. The introduction will take place. It will take just 2-3 minutes.'"Everybody went out, but Sunil said, 'I am not coming.' He said, 'Let me concentrate. My batting is important for me and my team.' They left him alone.PollWhich aspect of Sunil Gavaskar's career do you find most impressive?His dedication to batting.His ability to remain unfazed under pressure.His consistency over the years."Sunil batted till tea, and scored some runs also. At the end of the day’s play, we didn’t know that the PM had come to the dressing room only to meet Gavaskar."This is how Sunil Gavaskar, in his prime, right from 1971 to 1987, was always a champion. He could get away with murder."The former Indian pacer recalled a few incidents to illustrate how Sunil Gavaskar often had his way, no matter the circumstances. One of the most infamous examples came during the 1975 World Cup, when Gavaskar played a painfully slow innings of 36 runs off 174 balls. The knock left his teammates in the dressing room frustrated, yet the Little Master remained unmoved and stuck to his approach."We, as Indian cricketers, did not know how to play one-day cricket. In the first match, England scored 334, but when we came to bat, Sunil played out all 60 overs in that particular match," Ghavri said."So many times, messages were sent, asking him to either accelerate or get out, trying to pick up the pace. But Sunil Gavaskar was Sunil Gavaskar in the 1970s."He wouldn't listen to anyone. He just played out Tony Greig, Geoff Arnold, Chris Old and Bob Willis. The reason he gave after the match was, 'I was facing these guys, practising against them for the Test matches in the future.'"There was turmoil in the dressing room. When our manager asked him, Gavaskar said, 'Leave me alone'," Ghavri added.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. From running live blogs for India and non-India cricket matches to global spectacles featuring Indian talents, like the Chess World Cup final featuring Praggnanandhaa and the Badminton World Championships semifinal featuring HS Prannoy, our live coverage extends to all mega sporting events. The desk is also adept at writing comprehensive match reports and insightful post-match commentary, complemented by stats-based articles that provide an in-depth analysis of player performances and team dynamics.

Stunner! Rinku Singh roars in celebration after taking first-ball wicket in UP T20 - Watch
Rinku Singh showcased his versatility in the UP T20 League 2025 opener, stunning Kanpur Superstars with a first-ball wicket. Meerut Mavericks, powered by Madhav Kaushik's explosive 95, posted a massive 225/2. Kanpur faltered in response, managing only 139/9 as Meerut secured a dominant 86-run victory, with Rinku's all-round effort drawing attention to his potential inclusion in the Asia Cup squad.

Rinku Singh roars in celebration after taking first-ball wicket in UP T20 - WatchStunner! Rinku Singh roars in celebration after taking first-ball wicket in UP T20 - WatchTOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM /  Aug 18, 2025, 16:02 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeRinku Singh showcased his versatility in the UP T20 League 2025 opener, stunning Kanpur Superstars with a first-ball wicket. Meerut Mavericks, powered by Madhav Kaushik's explosive 95, posted a massive 225/2. Kanpur faltered in response, managing only 139/9 as Meerut secured a dominant 86-run victory, with Rinku's all-round effort drawing attention to his potential inclusion in the Asia Cup squad. Rinku Singh's fiery celebration in the UP T20 League (Screengrabs) Rinku Singh, widely known for role as a middle-order finisher, produced a moment of magic with the ball in the opening clash of the UP T20 League 2025. Leading the Meerut Mavericks against the Kanpur Superstars at the Bharat Ratna Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Stadium in Lucknow, Rinku struck with his very first delivery, sending the stumps flying and roaring in celebration. The part-time off-spinner, who has been under the radar of selectors ahead of the Asia Cup 2025, clean bowled Kanpur opener Aadarsh Singh in the powerplay. The dismissal not only stunned the opposition and brought out a passionate celebration from the player. He pumped his fist, let out a roar and then was congratulated by his teammates.Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW! Earlier in the evening, Meerut Mavericks had posted a formidable 225/2. After a quick start from Akshay Dubey (44 off 26) and Rituraj Sharma (60 off 36), it was Madhav Kaushik who stole the show. Walking in at No. 4, Kaushik blazed his way to an unbeaten 95 off just 31 balls, striking 10 fours and seven sixes at a staggering strike rate of 306. His fireworks ensured Meerut set Kanpur a daunting 226-run target. In reply, the Superstars never found momentum. Reduced to 13/3 inside the powerplay, they were eventually restricted to 139/9. Only three batters managed to reach double figures in what turned out to be a one-sided contest.PollWill Rinku Singh make it to the Asia Cup 2025 squad?Yes, his performance warrants itNo, he needs to do moreHard to call, there are many options The Mavericks sealed an emphatic 86-run victory, but it was Rinku’s first-ball strike and passionate celebration that stole the headlines. With the Asia Cup squad selection looming large, the effort from the left-hander served as a timely reminder of his ability, not just with the bat, but also as a bowler.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. Arjun Tendulkar’s fiancée Saaniya Chandhok spotted in old video with Sara Tendulkar – Watch
An old video of Sara Tendulkar with Saaniya Chandhok, Arjun Tendulkar's fiancée, has resurfaced, showcasing their close bond. The video, originally shared in August 2024, captures the trio enjoying a day at a petting zoo and pig farm in the UK. This resurfaced clip highlights Saaniya's long-standing connection with the Tendulkar family, prior to her recent engagement to Arjun in a private ceremony.
Blast from the past: Arjun Tendulkar’s fiancée Saaniya Chandhok spotted in old video with Sara Tendulkar – Watch | Off the field News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIsportsCricketNFLNBANHLCollege FootballMLCAsia Cup 2025Live Cricket ScoreMLBEsportsInternational SportsFormula EWWEF1MMATennisBadmintonHockeyWeb StoriesVideosRacingAthleticsWrestlingShootingBoxingChessIPL 2025Today's ePaperNewsSports NewsBlast from the past: Arjun Tendulkar’s fiancée Saaniya Chandhok spotted in old video with Sara Tendulkar – WatchTrendingNeymar JRSaaniya ChandhokMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliJaved MiandadKedar JadhavR AshwinNeymar JRSaaniya ChandhokMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliJaved MiandadKedar JadhavR AshwinNeymar JRSaaniya ChandhokMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliJaved MiandadKedar JadhavR AshwinBlast from the past: Arjun Tendulkar’s fiancée Saaniya Chandhok spotted in old video with Sara Tendulkar – WatchTOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Aug 18, 2025, 12:52 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeAn old video of Sara Tendulkar with Saaniya Chandhok, Arjun Tendulkar's fiancée, has resurfaced, showcasing their close bond. The video, originally shared in August 2024, captures the trio enjoying a day at a petting zoo and pig farm in the UK. This resurfaced clip highlights Saaniya's long-standing connection with the Tendulkar family, prior to her recent engagement to Arjun in a private ceremony. Sara Tendulkar and Saaniya Chandhok (Screengrab - Instagram/@saratendulkar) An old video of Sara Tendulkar has resurfaced online, offering a glimpse of her close friendship with Saaniya Chandhok, who recently got engaged to Sara’s brother, Arjun Tendulkar. The clip, originally shared by Sara in a collaborative post on August 2023, shows the two along with a friend enjoying a day out at Kew Little Pigs Farm in the United Kingdom. The farm, which describes itself as “a multi award-winning miniature pig farm with a variety of unique experiences,” allows visitors to feed and play with animals in its petting pens.Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!Arjun Tendulkar Visits Siddhivinayak Temple In the video, the trio can be seen petting piglets and sheep, feeding them, and posing for pictures with the animals. Captioned “Three little piggies went on an adventure,” the vlog gave yet another sneak peek into the close relationship between Sara and Arjun Tendulkar's fiancée Saaniya. The video has now gained attention following the news of Saaniya’s engagement to Arjun Tendulkar earlier this week. The 25-year-old cricketer, son of batting legend Sachin Tendulkar, formalised his relationship with Saaniya in a private ceremony on August 13, attended by close friends and family. The resurfaced clip underlines how long Saaniya has been part of the Tendulkar family circle, even before her engagement. Sara’s post from last year reflects the bond the two shared, which has now taken on greater significance.PollWhat do you think of the engagement ceremony of Arjun Tendulkar and Saaniya Chandhok?It should have been a grand event.I prefer intimate ceremonies. Saaniya, 26, is the granddaughter of businessman Ravi Ghai and belongs to a family with strong ties to India’s food and hospitality sector. The Ghai family’s Graviss Group manages Baskin Robbins’ India operations and owns The Brooklyn Creamery. Graviss Food Solutions Private Limited reported revenues of ₹624 crore for FY23-24.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. Watch Here!About the AuthorTOI Sports DeskThe TOI Sports Desk excels in a myriad of roles that capture the essence of live sporting events and deliver compelling content to readers worldwide. 

From running live blogs for India and non-India cricket matches to global spectacles featuring Indian talents, like the Chess World Cup final featuring Praggnanandhaa and the Badminton World Championships semifinal featuring HS Prannoy, our live coverage extends to all mega sporting events. We extensively cover events like the Olympics, Asian Games, Cricket World Cups, FIFA World Cups, and more. 

The desk is also adept at writing comprehensive match reports and insightful post-match commentary, complemented by stats-based articles that provide an in-depth analysis of player performances and team dynamics. 

We track news wires for key stories, conduct exclusive player interviews in both text and video formats, and file content from print editions and reporters. We keep track of all viral stories, trending topics and produce our own copies on the subjects.

Shah Rukh Khan and Cricket! Temba Bavuma and Mitchell Marsh strike iconic SRK pose
Ahead of their ODI series, Australian and South African captains Mitchell Marsh and Temba Bavuma unexpectedly recreated Shah Rukh Khan's iconic pose during a photoshoot, captivating fans online. While the moment provided light-hearted amusement, both teams are focused on the upcoming series. Bavuma returns from injury to lead a strengthened South African squad against Marsh's Australia.
Shah Rukh Khan and Cricket! Temba Bavuma and Mitchell Marsh strike iconic SRK pose - See pictures | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIsportsCricketNFLNBANHLCollege FootballMLCAsia Cup 2025Live Cricket ScoreMLBEsportsInternational SportsFormula EWWEF1MMATennisBadmintonHockeyWeb StoriesVideosRacingAthleticsWrestlingShootingBoxingChessIPL 2025Today's ePaperIPL 2025WPLCricket ScheduleLive Cricket ScoreICC RankingsNewsSports NewsCricket NewsShah Rukh Khan and Cricket! Temba Bavuma and Mitchell Marsh strike iconic SRK pose - See picturesTrendingNeymar JRSaaniya ChandhokMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliJaved MiandadKedar JadhavR AshwinNeymar JRSaaniya ChandhokMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliJaved MiandadKedar JadhavR AshwinNeymar JRSaaniya ChandhokMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliJaved MiandadKedar JadhavR AshwinShah Rukh Khan and Cricket! Temba Bavuma and Mitchell Marsh strike iconic SRK pose - See picturesTOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM /  Aug 18, 2025, 14:09 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeAhead of their ODI series, Australian and South African captains Mitchell Marsh and Temba Bavuma unexpectedly recreated Shah Rukh Khan's iconic pose during a photoshoot, captivating fans online. While the moment provided light-hearted amusement, both teams are focused on the upcoming series. Bavuma returns from injury to lead a strengthened South African squad against Marsh's Australia. Temba Bavuma and Mitchell Marsh in a photoshoot ahead of the ODI series that will start on Tuesday (Picture credit - Cricket Australia) Australia and South Africa are gearing up for the start of their three-match ODI series in Australia, but it was an off-field moment that grabbed fans’ attention ahead of the opener on Tuesday, August 19. In a photoshoot ahead of the series commencing, skippers Mitchell Marsh and Temba Bavuma posed with the ODI series trophy and the flags of their respective nations. But what truly broke the internet was the pair unexpectedly imitating Bollywood superstar Shah Rukh Khan’s iconic pose.Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW! With arms stretched wide and shoulders tilted, both captains recreated the trademark stance made famous by Khan on screen. The actor, adored by his several millions of fans in the country, won his maiden National Award for Best Actor for Jawan, a film that became a box-office blockbuster. The images quickly went viral on social media, leaving fans amused at the crossover moment between cricket and cinema.Temba Bavuma and Mitchell Marsh imitating Shah Rukh Khan's iconic pose (Picture credit - Cricket Australia)Temba Bavuma and Mitchell Marsh with the ODI series trophy (Picture credit - Cricket Australia) While the photoshoot provided a light-hearted moment, both sides head into the series with serious intent. Marsh will lead Australia. The all-rounder is not expecting much change in Australia’s aggressive batting approach, one that saw them claim a 2-1 T20I series win despite several early batting collapses.PollWhich team do you think will win the ODI series between Australia and South Africa?AustraliaSouth Africa South Africa, meanwhile, welcome back Bavuma, who has recovered from a hamstring injury and returns to lead a refreshed squad. The Proteas have added five players for the ODIs, including spinner Keshav Maharaj, Test triple-centurion Wiaan Mulder and top-order batters Matthew Breetzke and Tony de Zorzi. Rising star Dewald Brevis, who lit up the T20Is with a 41-ball century in Darwin and a fifty in Cairns, could also make his ODI debut. As the cricketing rivalry resumes, the viral Shah Rukh Khan tribute has given the build-up an entertaining twist, adding an unexpected layer of colour to what promises to be a competitive series.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. Watch Here!About the AuthorTOI Sports DeskThe TOI Sports Desk excels in a myriad of roles that capture the essence of live sporting events and deliver compelling content to readers worldwide. 

From running live blogs for India and non-India cricket matches to global spectacles featuring Indian talents, like the Chess World Cup final featuring Praggnanandhaa and the Badminton World Championships semifinal featuring HS Prannoy, our live coverage extends to all mega sporting events. We extensively cover events like the Olympics, Asian Games, Cricket World Cups, FIFA World Cups, and more. 

The desk is also adept at writing comprehensive match reports and insightful post-match commentary, complemented by stats-based articles that provide an in-depth analysis of player performances and team dynamics. 

We track news wires for key stories, conduct exclusive player interviews in both text and video formats, and file content from print editions and reporters. We keep track of all viral stories, trending topics and produce our own copies on the subjects. 

We deliver accurate, engaging, and up-to-the-minute sports content, round the clock.Read MoreEnd of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   Previous8 best anti-ageing ingredients you should start using in your 20sLifestyle10 best vegetarian sources of IronLifestyleSalwar tales by gorgeous lady Shabana ShajahantvCars under Rs 6 lakh with six airbags: Maruti Alto, Nissan Magnite and moreautoKundali Bhagya fame Shraddha Arya’s stunning ethnic lookstvAnupama Parameswaran shines bright in striking snapsEntertainment'Coolie' actress Reba Monica John’s picture-perfect momentsEntertainmentMalavika Mohanan's stunning style moments you can't missEntertainmentJannat Zubair’s Gen-Z Style is Pure PerfectiontvEver heard of Flying fish? Debut on a new pitch? Pathan may join politics - 'Aapko lagta hai aana chahiye?'
Following his brother Yusuf's successful entry into politics and victory in the Baharampur Lok Sabha seat, Irfan Pathan has hinted at a potential foray into the political arena. When questioned about his interest, the former India all-rounder expressed his desire to make a difference, suggesting that he would only join politics if he could positively impact society.
Debut on a new pitch? Irfan Pathan drops hint of joining politics - 'Aapko lagta hai aana chahiye?' | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIsportsCricketNFLNBANHLCollege FootballMLCAsia Cup 2025Live Cricket ScoreMLBEsportsInternational SportsFormula EWWEF1MMATennisBadmintonHockeyWeb StoriesVideosRacingAthleticsWrestlingShootingBoxingChessIPL 2025Today's ePaperIPL 2025WPLCricket ScheduleLive Cricket ScoreICC RankingsNewsSports NewsCricket NewsDebut on a new pitch? Irfan Pathan drops hint of joining politics - 'Aapko lagta hai aana chahiye?'TrendingNeymar JRArjun TendulkarMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliJaved MiandadKedar JadhavR AshwinNeymar JRArjun TendulkarMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliJaved MiandadKedar JadhavR AshwinNeymar JRArjun TendulkarMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliJaved MiandadKedar JadhavR AshwinDebut on a new pitch? Irfan Pathan drops hint of joining politics - 'Aapko lagta hai aana chahiye?'TOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Aug 18, 2025, 12:10 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeFollowing his brother Yusuf's successful entry into politics and victory in the Baharampur Lok Sabha seat, Irfan Pathan has hinted at a potential foray into the political arena. When questioned about his interest, the former India all-rounder expressed his desire to make a difference, suggesting that he would only join politics if he could positively impact society. **EDS: THIRD PARTY** In this image posted by @iamyusufpathan via X on Monday, March 31, 2025, TMC MP and former cricketer Yusuf Pathan celebrates Eid with father Mehmood Khan Pathan and brother Irfan Pathan. (@iamyusufpathan via PTI Photo)    *** Local Caption *** A year after his elder brother Yusuf Pathan joined politics and went on to win from the Baharampur Lok Sabha seat in West Bengal's Murshidabad district for the Trinamool Congress, younger brother Irfan Pathan, too, has shown interest in following his brother's path.Yusuf Pathan had defeated Congress veteran Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury, who had been winning the Baharampur constituency since 1999 and had consecutively won Lok Sabha elections.IRFAN PATHAN FLYING FROM MUMBAI SPOTTED AT AIRPORTGo Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!During a recent interview with The Lallantop, when the anchor coaxed Irfan Pathan about whether he is interested in joining politics, the former India all-rounder said: "Aapko lagta hai aana chahiye? (Do you think I should join?)"He then made it more specific and stated: “Mai jo bhi karoonga apni zindagi mey... aage jaa ke ya abhi hamesha difference paida karne ke liye karoonga aur agar nahi kar paaya toh nahi karoonga (Whatever I do in my life—whether now or in the future—I will always do it to make a difference. And if I cannot make a difference, then I won’t do it at all).”PollShould Irfan Pathan join politics like his brother Yusuf Pathan?Yes, he shouldNo, he should focus on cricketOnly if he wants to make a differenceNot surePathan played 29 Tests, 120 ODIs and 24 T20Is, claiming 301 international wickets before retiring in 2020.He burst onto the international scene in 2003 as a teenager, drawing comparisons with Wasim Akram. At his peak, he could swing the new ball prodigiously and contribute vital runs down the order, earning comparisons with Kapil Dev. His hat-trick against Pakistan in the 2006 Karachi Test remains historic. A match-winning spell in the 2007 T20 World Cup final cemented his reputation as a big-match player.Whether he will join politics or not, only time will tell, but the 40-year-old has certainly teased fans about his future.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. From running live blogs for India and non-India cricket matches to global spectacles featuring Indian talents, like the Chess World Cup final featuring Praggnanandhaa and the Badminton World Championships semifinal featuring HS Prannoy, our live coverage extends to all mega sporting events. We extensively cover events like the Olympics, Asian Games, Cricket World Cups, FIFA World Cups, and more. 

The desk is also adept at writing comprehensive match reports and insightful post-match commentary, complemented by stats-based articles that provide an in-depth analysis of player performances and team dynamics. 

We track news wires for key stories, conduct exclusive player interviews in both text and video formats, and file content from print editions and reporters. We keep track of all viral stories, trending topics and produce our own copies on the subjects.

'Always in front of mirror, obsessed with looking good': Klaasen names SRH player
Heinrich Klaasen revealed amusing dressing-room banter of Sunrisers Hyderabad, playfully teasing teammates. Ishan Kishan, known for his obsession with looking good, was singled out for being the mirror magnet and his acting skills. Adam Zampa's ever-changing hairstyles also drew humorous attention, while captain Pat Cummins received a light-hearted jab about his acting abilities, showcasing the team's camaraderie.
'Always in front of mirror, obsessed with looking good': Heinrich Klaasen namedrops SRH player | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIsportsCricketNFLNBANHLCollege FootballMLCAsia Cup 2025Live Cricket ScoreMLBEsportsInternational SportsFormula EWWEF1MMATennisBadmintonHockeyWeb StoriesVideosRacingAthleticsWrestlingShootingBoxingChessIPL 2025Today's ePaperIPL 2025WPLCricket ScheduleLive Cricket ScoreICC RankingsNewsSports NewsCricket News'Always in front of mirror, obsessed with looking good': Heinrich Klaasen namedrops SRH playerTrendingNeymar JRSaaniya ChandhokMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliJaved MiandadKedar JadhavR AshwinNeymar JRSaaniya ChandhokMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliJaved MiandadKedar JadhavR AshwinNeymar JRSaaniya ChandhokMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliJaved MiandadKedar JadhavR Ashwin'Always in front of mirror, obsessed with looking good': Heinrich Klaasen namedrops SRH playerTOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM /  Aug 18, 2025, 13:19 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeHeinrich Klaasen revealed amusing dressing-room secrets of Sunrisers Hyderabad, playfully teasing teammates. Ishan Kishan, known for his meticulous grooming, was singled out for his mirror obsession and acting skills. Adam Zampa's ever-changing hairstyles also drew humorous attention, while captain Pat Cummins received a light-hearted jab about his acting abilities, showcasing the team's camaraderie. Heinrich Klaasen and Ishan Kishan (Images via Getty Images & Instagram/@ishankishan23) Heinrich Klaasen gave fans a peek into the lighter side of the Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) team, sharing some amusing dressing-room secrets during a candid interaction with the franchise. The South African wicketkeeper-batter didn’t hold back while poking fun at his teammates, with Ishan Kishan emerging as the central figure of his playful comments. Kishan, who joined SRH in the IPL 2025 auction for ₹11.25 crore after being released by Mumbai Indians, was singled out for always being in front of the mirror. When asked who in the squad was the mirror magnet, Klaasen responded with a laugh: “Doing a couple of shoots with him, I would say Ishan (Kishan).”Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW! He went on to explain that the left-handed batter is extremely particular about his appearance. “Ishan really needs to get his hair perfectly to be happy,” Klaasen remarked, adding that Kishan’s obsession with grooming stands out in the squad. However, Klaasen didn’t let Kishan take the entire spotlight, pointing out that Australian leg-spinner Adam Zampa is also right up there when it comes to hairstyles. Referring to Zampa’s exciting hairstyles over the years, he joked that the spinner probably is the "haircut enthusiast".PollWho has the best hairstyle in the SRH team?Ishan KishanAdam Zampa Kishan was again at the center of attention when Klaasen was asked about the best actor in the SRH squad. Without hesitation, he named the 27-year-old. “We did a shoot and he was unbelievable,” Klaasen recalled, praising Kishan’s ability to perform in front of the camera. The banter didn’t stop there. Klaasen also aimed a cheeky dig at his captain, Pat Cummins. “His acting is just OK. But there are low budget movies, so we give it to him,” he quipped, leaving fans with a glimpse of the light-hearted atmosphere within the SRH unit.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. Watch Here!About the AuthorTOI Sports DeskThe TOI Sports Desk excels in a myriad of roles that capture the essence of live sporting events and deliver compelling content to readers worldwide. 

From running live blogs for India and non-India cricket matches to global spectacles featuring Indian talents, like the Chess World Cup final featuring Praggnanandhaa and the Badminton World Championships semifinal featuring HS Prannoy, our live coverage extends to all mega sporting events. We extensively cover events like the Olympics, Asian Games, Cricket World Cups, FIFA World Cups, and more. 

The desk is also adept at writing comprehensive match reports and insightful post-match commentary, complemented by stats-based articles that provide an in-depth analysis of player performances and team dynamics. 

We track news wires for key stories, conduct exclusive player interviews in both text and video formats, and file content from print editions and reporters. We keep track of all viral stories, trending topics and produce our own copies on the subjects.

Cricket | 'Ek banda fail hue ja raha hai...' - Pathan backs Gambhir to end 'star culture'
Irfan Pathan supports Gautam Gambhir's focus on team culture over star culture in Indian cricket, emphasizing the need to move past favoring established players despite performance decline. Pathan also praises selector Ajit Agarkar's balanced approach and highlights the importance of coach-selector alignment in decision-making for fostering a merit-based environment. This shift aims to define a new era for Indian cricket.
Cricket | 'Ek banda fail hue ja raha hai 3, 4, 5 saal...' - Irfan Pathan backs Gautam Gambhir to end India’s 'star culture' | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIsportsCricketNFLNBANHLCollege FootballMLCAsia Cup 2025Live Cricket ScoreMLBEsportsInternational SportsFormula EWWEF1MMATennisBadmintonHockeyWeb StoriesVideosRacingAthleticsWrestlingShootingBoxingChessIPL 2025Today's ePaperIPL 2025WPLCricket ScheduleLive Cricket ScoreICC RankingsNewsSports NewsCricket NewsCricket | 'Ek banda fail hue ja raha hai 3, 4, 5 saal...' - Irfan Pathan backs Gautam Gambhir to end India’s 'star culture'TrendingNeymar JRArjun TendulkarMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliJaved MiandadKedar JadhavR AshwinNeymar JRArjun TendulkarMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliJaved MiandadKedar JadhavR AshwinNeymar JRArjun TendulkarMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliJaved MiandadKedar JadhavR AshwinCricket | 'Ek banda fail hue ja raha hai 3, 4, 5 saal...' - Irfan Pathan backs Gautam Gambhir to end India’s 'star culture'TOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Aug 18, 2025, 11:03 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeIrfan Pathan supports Gautam Gambhir's focus on team culture over star culture in Indian cricket, emphasizing the need to move past favoring established players despite performance decline. Pathan also praises selector Ajit Agarkar's balanced approach and highlights the importance of coach-selector alignment in decision-making for fostering a merit-based environment. This shift aims to define a new era for Indian cricket. LONDON, ENGLAND - AUGUST 04: India coach Gautam Gambhir with Mohammed Siraj of India after the end of the match on day five of the 5th Rothesay Test Match at The Kia Oval on August 04, 2025 in London, England. (Photo by Gareth Copley/Getty Images) Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan has thrown his weight behind head coach Gautam Gambhir, praising him for prioritising “team culture” over “star culture” in Indian cricket. Speaking candidly, Pathan highlighted how long-standing favoritism towards established names had often hurt promising players, and suggested that Gambhir, alongside chairman of selectors Ajit Agarkar, is determined to bring lasting change in Indian cricket.“Mere liye team culture bahut important hai. (For me, team culture is very important). Gautam Gambhir jo hai na wahaan pe, jab tak wo apni coaching journey khatam karenge na, wo team culture le ke aayenge puri tarah se. (As long as Gambhir is the coach, he will fully instill team culture),” Pathan told Lallantop.Gautam Gambhir's fiery press conferences: Every time the India head coach lost his coolGo Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!The former left-arm pacer also spoke on how Indian cricket has, at times, been reluctant to move on from struggling players due to their past reputation. “Humare yahaan ek banda fail hue ja raha hai 3, 4, 5 saal se magar usko chance de do kyunki wo bahut bada player hai. Kahi toh aapko full stop lagana padega na. (Here, a player keeps failing for 3, 4, 5 years, but still gets opportunities because he is a big name. Somewhere, you have to put a full stop),” he explained.Pathan praised the current selection panel, led by Agarkar, for their balanced approach in picking teams. “Dusra jinka naam nahi aata, wo banda abada jabardast hai Indian cricket ke liye — chairman of selectors Ajit Agarkar. (The other person who deserves credit is Ajit Agarkar, he is fantastic for Indian cricket),” Pathan said.PollDo you agree with Irfan Pathan's view that team culture is more important than star culture in cricket?Strongly AgreeAgreeDisagreeStrongly DisagreeHighlighting the decision-making process, Pathan stressed the importance of alignment between coach and selectors. “Aaj ek koi bhi decision hota hai na, wo sirf coach nahi le sakta, ek koi bhi decision selector nahi le sakta. Do log agar mil jaaye, jo majboot ho wo fir sahi direction mey jaate hai. Mujhe lagta hai ye dono sahi direction me ja rahe hai... team culture ko le kar. (Today, no decision can be taken solely by the coach or solely by the selector. If two strong individuals come together, the team moves in the right direction. I believe Gambhir and Agarkar are doing that with team culture),” he added.Pathan’s words reflect growing support for Gambhir’s philosophy of reducing individual favoritism and ensuring merit-based opportunities — a shift that could define the next era of Indian cricket.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. From running live blogs for India and non-India cricket matches to global spectacles featuring Indian talents, like the Chess World Cup final featuring Praggnanandhaa and the Badminton World Championships semifinal featuring HS Prannoy, our live coverage extends to all mega sporting events. We extensively cover events like the Olympics, Asian Games, Cricket World Cups, FIFA World Cups, and more. 

The desk is also adept at writing comprehensive match reports and insightful post-match commentary, complemented by stats-based articles that provide an in-depth analysis of player performances and team dynamics. 

We track news wires for key stories, conduct exclusive player interviews in both text and video formats, and file content from print editions and reporters. We keep track of all viral stories, trending topics and produce our own copies on the subjects.

'Perform in BBL': PAK coach explains how Babar Azam can return after Asia Cup snub
Pakstan coach Mike Hesson suggests Babar Azam's T20I return hinges on Big Bash League performance, emphasizing the need for improvement against spin and a better strike rate. Selectors have sidelined him from upcoming tournaments, prioritizing players who can maintain a faster run rate. Pakstan's Asia Cup campaign begins on September 12.
'Perform in BBL':  PAK coach Mike Hesson explains how Babar Azam can return to T20I squad after Asia Cup snub | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIAsia CupSchedulePoints TableT20 RankingsIND Vs PAK: Face-OffIND Vs BAN: Face-OffToday's ePaperNewsSports NewsCricket News'Perform in BBL':  PAK coach Mike Hesson explains how Babar Azam can return to T20I squad after Asia Cup snubTrendingNeymar JRArjun TendulkarMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliJaved MiandadKedar JadhavR AshwinNeymar JRArjun TendulkarMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliJaved MiandadKedar JadhavR AshwinNeymar JRArjun TendulkarMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliJaved MiandadKedar JadhavR Ashwin'Perform in BBL':  PAK coach Mike Hesson explains how Babar Azam can return to T20I squad after Asia Cup snubTOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM /  Aug 18, 2025, 11:13 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargePakstan coach Mike Hesson suggests Babar Azam's T20I return hinges on Big Bash League performance, emphasizing the need for improvement against spin and a better strike rate. Selectors have sidelined him from upcoming tournaments, prioritizing players who can maintain a faster run rate. Pakstan's Asia Cup campaign begins on September 12. Babar Azam and Mike Hesson (Images via Getty Images) Pakstan coach Mike Hesson has hinted that Babar Azam’s path back into the national T20I side could run through Australia’s Big Bash League later this year. The 30-year-old has been sidelined from the shortest format since late 2024, with selectors leaving him out of both the upcoming tri-series against UAE and Afghanistan and next month’s Asia Cup.'Perform in BBL': PAK coach Mike Hesson explains how Babar Azam can return to T20I squad after Asia Cup snub Hesson made it clear that while Babar remains a top-quality player, he needs to show progress in specific areas before reclaiming his spot. “There is no doubt Babar’s been asked to improve in some areas around taking on spin and in terms of his strike rate. Those are things he is working really hard on,” the coach said as quoted by the ICC.Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW! Babar’s recent form has been inconsistent. He struck 47 in the first ODI against West Indies in Trinidad but followed it with scores of 0 and 9. His T20 record last year, of 738 runs in 24 matches at strike rates of 129.22 and 133.21, invited criticism for not being quick enough in a format where acceleration is crucial. Hesson suggested that Babar’s best chance to make a statement will come in December and January, when he is expected to feature in the BBL. “A player like Babar has an opportunity to play in the BBL and show he is improving in those areas in T20s. He is too good a player not to consider,” Hesson said. The coach also explained why others had been preferred in the current squad. “At the moment the players we have, have done exceptionally well. Sahibzada Farhan has played six games (against Bangladesh and West Indies) and won three Player of the Match awards,” he pointed out. Mohammad Rizwan’s exclusion was another notable call, with selectors opting to back batters who consistently score at a high strike rate.PollWhat do you believe is the main reason for Babar Azam's exclusion from the T20I side?Inconsistent performanceOther players performing better Hesson stressed the importance of rewarding recent form. “We need a run rate that puts us ahead of the game. T20 is all about setting the game up and being ahead of the game all the time,” he said. Pakstan begin their Asia Cup campaign against Oman on September 12, before facing India on September 14.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. From running live blogs for India and non-India cricket matches to global spectacles featuring Indian talents, like the Chess World Cup final featuring Praggnanandhaa and the Badminton World Championships semifinal featuring HS Prannoy, our live coverage extends to all mega sporting events. We extensively cover events like the Olympics, Asian Games, Cricket World Cups, FIFA World Cups, and more. 

The desk is also adept at writing comprehensive match reports and insightful post-match commentary, complemented by stats-based articles that provide an in-depth analysis of player performances and team dynamics. 

We track news wires for key stories, conduct exclusive player interviews in both text and video formats, and file content from print editions and reporters. We keep track of all viral stories, trending topics and produce our own copies on the subjects.

'Greg Chappell caused insecurity in the team': Irfan Pathan reveals untold story
Irfan Pathan reflects on Greg Chappell's tenure as India's coach, acknowledging personal benefits but noting the cultural clash. Chappell's aggressive communication, emphasizing performance-based selection, created insecurity within the team. Pathan believes Chappell's intent was positive but his failure to adapt to Indian culture ultimately hindered his success, a crucial lesson in coaching.
'Greg Chappell caused insecurity in the team': Irfan Pathan reveals untold story of Chappell era | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIsportsCricketNFLNBANHLCollege FootballMLCAsia Cup 2025Live Cricket ScoreMLBEsportsInternational SportsFormula EWWEF1MMATennisBadmintonHockeyWeb StoriesVideosRacingAthleticsWrestlingShootingBoxingChessIPL 2025Today's ePaperIPL 2025WPLCricket ScheduleLive Cricket ScoreICC RankingsNewsSports NewsCricket News'Greg Chappell caused insecurity in the team': Irfan Pathan reveals untold story of Chappell eraTrendingNeymar JRArjun TendulkarMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliJaved MiandadKedar JadhavR AshwinNeymar JRArjun TendulkarMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliJaved MiandadKedar JadhavR AshwinNeymar JRArjun TendulkarMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliJaved MiandadKedar JadhavR Ashwin'Greg Chappell caused insecurity in the team': Irfan Pathan reveals untold story of Chappell eraTOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Aug 18, 2025, 12:13 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeIrfan Pathan reflects on Greg Chappell's tenure as India's coach, acknowledging personal benefits but noting the cultural clash. Chappell's aggressive communication, emphasizing performance-based selection, created insecurity within the team. Pathan believes Chappell's intent was positive but his failure to adapt to Indian culture ultimately hindered his success, a crucial lesson in coaching. Irfan Pathan and Greg Chappell (Getty Images)  NEW DELHI: Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan has opened up on Greg Chappell’s controversial stint as Team India’s head coach, offering a balanced view of the Australian’s methods. Pathan admitted that he personally benefited under Chappell, but also highlighted how the coach’s aggressive approach clashed with Indian cricketing culture, eventually contributing to a turbulent phase that included Sourav Ganguly’s removal as captain and India’s early exit from the 2007 ODI World Cup.Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!Pathan recalled how Chappell’s style created insecurity within the squad."He had his way of treating seniors and juniors with the same respect. But in that, he would be a bit more aggressive than one would like. He would tell anyone that if they don't perform, they will be dropped. I realised it was too aggressive, and once I talked to him privately about it," Pathan said on The Lallantop.IRFAN PATHAN FLYING FROM MUMBAI SPOTTED AT AIRPORT"I told him that we already know what you keep saying about being dropped. You don't need to tell us. It is causing insecurity in the team. He looked at me for a while, got a bit upset and threw some choicest of words, but then he realised I was right," he added.Pathan stressed that Chappell’s failure was not in intent but in cultural adaptation."If I go to Bangladesh or Sri Lanka or England as a coach, and if I don't accept their culture, would their players accept me? Greg Chappell's intention was right, but he wanted to bring an Australian culture. He wanted us to play hard cricket and didn't care what background anyone came from. But you can certainly do it in a much better way."Sharing his own county cricket experience, Pathan underlined why blending into a team’s environment is crucial."I played for Middlesex County club. You play a four-day match, then you drive the next day. They gather everyone in a bar before the match. I don't drink, but I need to accept their culture. You are a part of the team, and you need to blend in. If Chappell hadn't missed that one thing, he would've been one of the best coaches," he concluded.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4.
