Saswata distances himself from The Bengal Files row
Amidst controversy surrounding historical accuracy of 'The Bengal Files,' actor Saswata Chatterjee has distanced himself, clarifying his role as an actor, not a historian. He stated that verifying historical claims isn't his responsibility. Chatterjee also mentioned his unawareness of the film's title change and director Vivek Agnihotri claimed the trailer launch was halted due to lack of permission.
'The Bengal Files': Saswata Chatterjee says he is ‘not a historian,’ as he distances himself from the Vivek Agnuhotri directed film after trailer screening halts in Kolkata | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamiltelugumalayalamkannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmenthindibollywood'The Bengal Files': Saswata Chatterjee says he is ‘not a historian,’ as he distances himself from the Vivek Agnuhotri directed film after trailer screening halts in KolkataTrendingCoolie Box Office CollectionJaved AkhtarArmaan MalikShah Rukh KhanWar 2AjithSunjay KapurAnushka SharmaRajesh KhannaDarshan ThoogudeepaCoolie Box Office CollectionJaved AkhtarArmaan MalikShah Rukh KhanWar 2AjithSunjay KapurAnushka SharmaRajesh KhannaDarshan ThoogudeepaCoolie Box Office CollectionJaved AkhtarArmaan MalikShah Rukh KhanWar 2AjithSunjay KapurAnushka SharmaRajesh KhannaDarshan Thoogudeepa'The Bengal Files': Saswata Chatterjee says he is ‘not a historian,’ as he distances himself from the Vivek Agnuhotri directed film after trailer screening halts in KolkataTOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 18, 2025, 12:01 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeAmidst controversy surrounding historical accuracy of 'The Bengal Files,' actor Saswata Chatterjee has distanced himself, clarifying his role as an actor, not a historian. He stated that verifying historical claims isn't his responsibility. Chatterjee also mentioned his unawareness of the film's title change and director Vivek Agnihotri claimed the trailer launch was halted due to lack of permission.  'The Bengal Files,' directed by Vivek Agnihotri, has been in the news due to a controversy surrounding its historical accuracy, which reportedly led to the cancellation of its trailer launch in Kolkata. Amid the debate, actor Saswata Chatterjee has distanced himself from the film, stating he is an actor, not a historian, and is therefore not qualified to verify the story's historical claims.Read on to learn more about what the actor has to say about 'The Bengal Files.'Sawasta Chatterjee distances himself from ‘The Bengal Files’ controversyIn his recent interview with The Wall, the actor stated that he simply played a character he liked and that it is not his responsibility as an actor to verify historical accuracy. He added that if others believe the film distorts history or belittles Bengal, they should take legal action instead of just creating a fuss."I liked a character and I played it. I am not a historian to think about what history says, and this is distorting history. It's not my job. If those whose job it is feel that Bengal is being belittled, then they can go to court with the information. There is no point in just making noise," Chatterjee said. Further distancing himself from the controversy, the actor added, “Let me tell you this. Nowadays, it's a trend; the whole story won't be told to anyone. You only get to know your track, your character. And when I was told about the role, I found the character to be amazing. It's a villain's character, and very few people get such characters to play."Sawasta Chatterjee claims he had no idea about the title changeSaswata Chatterjee stated that he was unaware of the change in the film's title from 'Delhi Files' to 'The Bengal Files.' He mentioned that the name change was decided after filming was completed and was not within his control. He said he would not understand the reason behind the change until he saw the movie."I will not understand why it happened till I watch the film. And even if anyone thinks that...making a noise will not help," Chatterjee remarked.‘The Bengal Files’ trailer launch rowDirector Vivek Agnihotri claimed that the trailer launch of his movie was halted on Saturday. Amid his claims, a senior police officer told NDTV that Agnihotri didn’t have the required permission for the screening; thus, he violated the law. About 'The Bengal Files''The Bengal Files' is an upcoming film directed by Vivek Agnihotri and marks the final part of his 'Files Trilogy' about modern Indian history. Following his earlier films, 'The Tashkent Files' (2019) and 'The Kashmir Files' (2022), this movie focuses on the events of the 1946 Great Calcutta killings. The film features Darshan Kumar, Pallavi Joshi, Simrat Kaur, Mithun Chakraborty, Anupam Kher, and Saswata Chatterjee, among others. It is scheduled to release on September 5, 2025."Get the latest news updates on Times of India, including reviews of the movie Coolie and War 2."About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. No red carpet goes unrolled, no stage goes dark - our team spans the globe, bringing you the latest scoops and insider insights from Bollywood to Hollywood, and every entertainment hotspot in between. We don't just report; we tell tales of stardom and stories untold. Whether it's the rise of a new sensation or the seasoned journey of an industry veteran, the TOI Entertainment Desk is your front-row seat to the fascinating narratives that shape the entertainment landscape. Beyond the breaking news, we present a celebration of culture. We explore the intersections of entertainment with society, politics, and everyday life.Read MoreEnd of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousSalwar tales by gorgeous lady Shabana ShajahantvKundali Bhagya fame Shraddha Arya’s stunning ethnic lookstvAnupama Parameswaran shines bright in striking snapsEntertainment'Coolie' actress Reba Monica John’s picture-perfect momentsEntertainmentMalavika Mohanan's stunning style moments you can't missEntertainmentJannat Zubair’s Gen-Z Style is Pure PerfectiontvEver heard of Flying fish? 'War 2': 5 major Box Office records - Deets inside
'War 2': Hrithik Roshan, Jr NTR, Kiara Advani's action film breaks 5 major Box Office records - Deets inside
'War 2': Hrithik Roshan, Jr NTR, Kiara Advani's action film breaks 5 major Box Office records - Deets inside Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsbox officemovie reviewsmovie listingsanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamilteluguNewsentertainmenthindibollywoodbox-office'War 2': Hrithik Roshan, Jr NTR, Kiara Advani's action film breaks 5 major Box Office records - Deets insideTrendingCoolie Box Office CollectionJaved AkhtarArmaan MalikShah Rukh KhanWar 2AjithSunjay KapurAnushka SharmaRajesh KhannaDarshan ThoogudeepaCoolie Box Office CollectionJaved AkhtarArmaan MalikShah Rukh KhanWar 2AjithSunjay KapurAnushka SharmaRajesh KhannaDarshan ThoogudeepaCoolie Box Office CollectionJaved AkhtarArmaan MalikShah Rukh KhanWar 2AjithSunjay KapurAnushka SharmaRajesh KhannaDarshan Thoogudeepa'War 2': Hrithik Roshan, Jr NTR, Kiara Advani's action film breaks 5 major Box Office records - Deets insideTOI Entertainment Desk / ETimes.in / Updated: Aug 18, 2025, 10:02 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeFollow us 1/6​'War 2' breaks 5 major Box Office records on opening dayHrithik Roshan, Jr NTR, and Kiara Advani’s 'War 2' turned into an event film with its grand multilingual release on August 14. Despite facing tough competition from Rajinikanth’s 'Coolie', it found its audience in the Hindi and Telugu markets, while Tamil remained dominated by the latter. With a massive budget to recover and mixed opinions among audiences, 'War 2' smashed several records on its first day.According to Sacnilk, 'War 2' took an opening of Rs 52 crore in India alone. From becoming Hrithik and Kiara’s biggest opener to landing the third spot on the Spyverse success list, the Ayan Mukerji directorial set new benchmarks.2/6​Surpassing Chhaava’s recordWith an opening of Rs 52 crore, 'War 2' has left Vicky Kaushal’s blockbuster 'Chhaava' far behind. The Laxman Utekar-directed historical film had an opening of Rs 33.10 crore. This huge margin shows how eagerly audiences were waiting for the Hrithik-Jr NTR action spectacle. It appears that the combination of big stars, high-octane action, and a popular franchise helped 'War 2' make a strong mark from day one.3/6​Claims third spot in the Spyverse seriesBy beating 'Ek Tha Tiger', 'Tiger Zinda Hai', and 'Tiger 3', 'War 2' claimed the third spot in the production house's spyverse franchise. Only Shah Rukh Khan’s 'Pathaan', which opened at Rs 57 crore, and Hrithik’s prequel 'War', which opened at Rs 53.35 crore, remain ahead.4/6​Second-highest opening of Indian cinema in 2025Though 'War 2' couldn’t beat 'Coolie' on its first day, it still grabbed the second-biggest opening of the year. By defeating 'Chhaava' and pushing it further down, the Hrithik-Jr NTR starrer movie showed its strong pull among audiences in India. 5/6​Hrithik Roshan’s biggest worldwide opening'War 2' has also become Hrithik Roshan’s biggest worldwide opener. The original 'War' earned Rs 78 crore globally on its first day, while the sequel collected Rs 84 crore. Hrithik’s star power and the film’s action-packed appeal have made this release a worldwide success, setting a new personal record for the actor.6/6​Kiara Advani’s highest openerFor Kiara Advani, 'War 2' is now her highest opener. The film has surpassed her previous hits, 'MS Dhoni: The Untold Story' and 'Kabir Singh'. Over the opening weekend, the film has already crossed Rs 170 crore in India, giving strong competition to Rajinikanth’s 'Coolie'. Alongside Hrithik and Jr NTR, the film also features Ashutosh Rana and Anil Kapoor.Follow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousMrunal Thakur redefines elegance in modern bridal wearindiaAn
